evidence_object.description: List of CURIES of all entities that form part of the evidence graph.

subject_closure.description: Reflexive closure of association_has_subject. A list of CURIEs. If an individual, first traverse rdf:tpye. The default closure is subclass, but other may optionally be added depending on what type of association this is and what the class is. E.g. for expression associations, the object is an anatomy class, and the closure will include part_of

subject_taxon.description: Taxonomic class of the subject. This is typically a CURIE of the form NCBITaxon:nnnn.

relation.description: A relationship type that connects the subject with object. TODO: check for correspondence in OBAN

object_class_closure.description: Reflexive closure of association_has_object. A list of CURIEs. If an individual, first traverse rdf:tpye. The default closure is subclass, but other may optionally be added depending on what type of association this is and what the class is. E.g. for expression associations, the object is an anatomy class, and the closure will include part_of

subject_taxon_closure.description: Reflexive closure of taxon. ALWAYS up SubClassOf.

subject_synonym.description: synonyms for the entity in the association.subject field.

object_closure.description: Reflexive closure of association_has_object. A list of CURIEs. If an individual, first traverse rdf:tpye. source.description: TBD: ALIGN GO AND DC TERMINOLOGY. Source of association. The association may be derived from multiple source, but this should be the 'outer' source, if applicable

object_category.description: Category of association.object. Examples: phenotype, function, process, location, tissue, gene. In GO this is called aspect

subject_family.description: PANTHER families that are associated with this entity.

subject_label.description: Label for association_subject. This will always be rdfs:label. Conventions may vary as to what goes in the label. For genes will be symbol, but we may choose to uniquify by prefixing with species

evidence.description: Evidence type. In Monarch we may have a graph/chain. This is always the 'outer' evidence OR a list of all evidence types used?

date.description: Date of assignment. The association may be derived from multiple source, but this should be the 'outer' source, if applicable.

disease_gene.result_weights: subject^7.0 relation^6.0  object^5.0 object_taxon^4.2 evidence^4.0 source^3.5

fields.description: The CURIE for oban:association_has_subject. May be disease, variant, gene, person, ....
Label for association_subject. This will always be rdfs:label. Conventions may vary as to what goes in the label. For genes will be symbol, but we may choose to uniquify by prefixing with species

Reflexive closure of association_has_subject. A list of CURIEs. If an individual, first traverse rdf:tpye. The default closure is subclass, but other may optionally be added depending on what type of association this is and what the class is. E.g. for expression associations, the object is an anatomy class, and the closure will include part_of
Taxonomic class of the subject. This is typically a CURIE of the form NCBITaxon:nnnn.
Reflexive closure of taxon. ALWAYS up SubClassOf.
The CURIE for oban:association_has_object. This is often, but not always an ontology class. E.g. for a gene-gene interaction it is an (arbitrary) member of the pair.

Reflexive closure of association_has_object. A list of CURIEs. If an individual, first traverse rdf:tpye. The default closure is subclass, but other may optionally be added depending on what type of association this is and what the class is. E.g. for expression associations, the object is an anatomy class, and the closure will include part_of
Taxonomic class of the object. This is typically a CURIE of the form NCBITaxon:nnnn. This field may be unfilled when used with certain categories
Reflexive closure of taxon. ALWAYS up SubClassOf.
List of CURIES of all entities that form part of the evidence graph.
List of CURIES of all entities that form part of the evidence closure.
A unique identifier (CURIE) for the association. Optional.
Category of association.subject. Examples: gene, protein, disease, variant
A more descriptive label or full name for association_subject. For a gene this may be the full name (as opposed to symbol).
synonyms for the entity in the association.subject field.
PANTHER families that are associated with this entity.
PANTHER families that are associated with this entity.
A relationship type that connects the subject with object. TODO: check for correspondence in OBAN
Association qualifier. TBD: NEGATION should probably be handled differently somehow
Category of association.object. Examples: phenotype, function, process, location, tissue, gene. In GO this is called aspect
Assoc object alternate form. E.g. for a canonical protein may be isoforms. Can we generalize this? May be deleted

Reflexive closure of association_has_object. A list of CURIEs. If an individual, first traverse rdf:tpye. The default closure is subclass, but other may optionally be added depending on what type of association this is and what the class is. E.g. for expression associations, the object is an anatomy class, and the closure will include part_of

Optional. This is similar to object_class_closure, but allows for the scenario whereby a different (more inclusive, or exclusive) closure is used. The exact OPs used will depend on the association type. This would ideally be communicating from loader conf through to the client somehow
TBD: ALIGN GO AND DC TERMINOLOGY. Source of association. The association may be derived from multiple source, but this should be the 'outer' source, if applicable
Date of assignment. The association may be derived from multiple source, but this should be the 'outer' source, if applicable.
TBD: ALIGN GO AND DC TERMINOLOGY. Source of association. The association may be derived from multiple source, but this should be the 'outer' source, if applicable
Evidence type. In Monarch we may have a graph/chain. This is always the 'outer' evidence OR a list of all evidence types used?
List of CURIES of all entities that form part of the evidence graph.

disease_gene.filter_weights: relation_closure_label^6.5 evidence_closure_label^6.0 subject_closure_label^4.5 object_closure_label^4.0 subject_taxon_closure_label^3.5 object_taxon_closure_label^3.0

model_gene.result_weights: subject^7.0 subject_taxon^6.5 relation^6.0  object^5.0 object_taxon^4.2 evidence^4.0 source^3.5

E.g. for expression associations, the object is an anatomy class, and the closure will include part_of

source.description: TBD: ALIGN GO AND DC TERMINOLOGY. Source of association. The association may be derived from multiple source, but this should be the 'outer' source, if applicable

object_category.description: Category of association.object. Examples: phenotype, function, process, location, tissue, gene. In GO this is called aspect

subject_label.description: Label for association_subject. This will always be rdfs:label. Conventions may vary as to what goes in the label. For genes will be symbol, but we may choose to uniquify by prefixing with species

subject_family.description: PANTHER families that are associated with this entity.

evidence_object.description: List of CURIES of all entities that form part of the evidence graph.

subject_closure.description: Reflexive closure of association_has_subject. A list of CURIEs. If an individual, first traverse rdf:tpye. The default closure is subclass, but other may optionally be added depending on what type of association this is and what the class is. E.g. for expression associations, the object is an anatomy class, and the closure will include part_of

relation.description: A relationship type that connects the subject with object. TODO: check for correspondence in OBAN

subject_taxon.description: Taxonomic class of the subject. This is typically a CURIE of the form NCBITaxon:nnnn.

object_class_closure.description: Reflexive closure of association_has_object. A list of CURIEs. If an individual, first traverse rdf:tpye. subject_taxon_closure.description: Reflexive closure of taxon. ALWAYS up SubClassOf.

E.g. for expression associations, the object is an anatomy class, and the closure will include part_of

subject_category.description: Category of association.subject. Examples: gene, protein, disease, variant

assigned_by.description: TBD: ALIGN GO AND DC TERMINOLOGY. Source of association. The association may be derived from multiple source, but this should be the 'outer' source, if applicable

object_taxon.description: Taxonomic class of the object. This is typically a CURIE of the form NCBITaxon:nnnn. This field may be unfilled when used with certain categories

subject_description.description: A more descriptive label or full name for association_subject. For a gene this may be the full name (as opposed to symbol).

evidence_closure_label.description: List of CURIES of all entities that form part of the evidence graph.

object_isoform.description: Assoc object alternate form. E.g. for a canonical protein may be isoforms. Can we generalize this? May be deleted

qualifier.description: Association qualifier. TBD: NEGATION should probably be handled differently somehow

id.description: A unique identifier (CURIE) for the association. Optional.

subject_family_label.description: PANTHER families that are associated with this entity.

subject.description: The CURIE for oban:association_has_subject. May be disease, variant, gene, person, ....

object_class_secondary_closure.description: Optional. This is similar to object_class_closure, but allows for the scenario whereby a different (more inclusive, or exclusive) closure is used. The exact OPs used will depend on the association type. This would ideally be communicating from loader conf through to the client somehow

evidence.description: Evidence type. In Monarch we may have a graph/chain. This is always the 'outer' evidence OR a list of all evidence types used?

date.description: Date of assignment. The association may be derived from multiple source, but this should be the 'outer' source, if applicable.

object_taxon_closure.description: Reflexive closure of taxon. ALWAYS up SubClassOf.

object.description: The CURIE for oban:association_has_object. This is often, but not always an ontology class. E.g. for a gene-gene interaction it is an (arbitrary) member of the pair.

evidence_object_closure_label.description: List of CURIES of all entities that form part of the evidence closure.

subject_taxon.description: Taxonomic class of the subject. This is typically a CURIE of the form NCBITaxon:nnnn.

relation.description: A relationship type that connects the subject with object. TODO: check for correspondence in OBAN

subject_closure.description: Reflexive closure of association_has_subject. A list of CURIEs. If an individual, first traverse rdf:tpye. The default closure is subclass, but other may optionally be added depending on what type of association this is and what the class is. E.g. for expression associations, the object is an anatomy class, and the closure will include part_of

object_class_closure.description: Reflexive closure of association_has_object. A list of CURIEs. If an individual, first traverse rdf:tpye. The default closure is subclass, but other may optionally be added depending on what type of association this is and what the class is. E.g. for expression associations, the object is an anatomy class, and the closure will include part_of

subject_taxon_closure.description: Reflexive closure of taxon. ALWAYS up SubClassOf.

subject_synonym.description: synonyms for the entity in the association.subject field.

object_closure.description: Reflexive closure of association_has_object. A list of CURIEs. If an individual, first traverse rdf:tpye. The default closure is subclass, but other may optionally be added depending on what type of association this is and what the class is. E.g. for expression associations, the object is an anatomy class, and the closure will include part_of

source.description: TBD: ALIGN GO AND DC TERMINOLOGY. Source of association. The association may be derived from multiple source, but this should be the 'outer' source, if applicable

subject_family.description: PANTHER families that are associated with this entity.

subject_label.description: Label for association_subject. This will always be rdfs:label. Conventions may vary as to what goes in the label. For genes will be symbol, but we may choose to uniquify by prefixing with species

object_category.description: Category of association.object. Examples: phenotype, function, process, location, tissue, gene. In GO this is called aspect

evidence.description: Evidence type. In Monarch we may have a graph/chain. This is always the 'outer' evidence OR a list of all evidence types used?

date.description: Date of assignment. The association may be derived from multiple source, but this should be the 'outer' source, if applicable.

subject.description: The CURIE for oban:association_has_subject. May be disease, variant, gene, person, ....

subject_family_label.description: PANTHER families that are associated with this entity.

object_class_secondary_closure.description: Optional. This is similar to object_class_closure, but allows for the scenario whereby a different (more inclusive, or exclusive) closure is used. The exact OPs used will depend on the association type. This would ideally be communicating from loader conf through to the client somehow

object.description: The CURIE for oban:association_has_object. This is often, but not always an ontology class. E.g. for a gene-gene interaction it is an (arbitrary) member of the pair.

evidence_object_closure_label.description: List of CURIES of all entities that form part of the evidence closure.

object_taxon_closure.description: Reflexive closure of taxon. ALWAYS up SubClassOf.

object_taxon.description: Taxonomic class of the object. This is typically a CURIE of the form NCBITaxon:nnnn. This field may be unfilled when used with certain categories

subject_description.description: A more descriptive label or full name for association_subject. For a gene this may be the full name (as opposed to symbol).

evidence_closure_label.description: List of CURIES of all entities that form part of the evidence graph.

subject_category.description: Category of association.subject. Examples: gene, protein, disease, variant

assigned_by.description: TBD: ALIGN GO AND DC TERMINOLOGY. Source of association. The association may be derived from multiple source, but this should be the 'outer' source, if applicable

id.description: A unique identifier (CURIE) for the association. Optional.

object_isoform.description: Assoc object alternate form. E.g. for a canonical protein may be isoforms. Can we generalize this? May be deleted

qualifier.description: Association qualifier. TBD: NEGATION should probably be handled differently somehow
